Metformin.purpose: Controls blood sugar in type 2 diabetes by reducing glucose production in the liver
Metformin.precautions: Take with food to reduce stomach upset. Avoid alcohol. Inform doctor before any surgery or CT scan with contrast.

Aspirin.purpose: Prevents blood clots, reduces fever and pain, used for heart attack prevention
Aspirin.precautions: Avoid if you have stomach ulcers. Take with food. Inform doctor before surgery.

Atorvastatin.purpose: Lowers LDL (bad) cholesterol and reduces risk of heart attack and stroke
Atorvastatin.precautions: Avoid grapefruit juice. Get regular liver function tests. Report any unexplained muscle pain immediately.

Lisinopril.purpose: Treats high blood pressure and heart failure, protects kidneys in diabetes
Lisinopril.precautions: Avoid in pregnancy. Monitor kidney function and potassium levels regularly.

Amlodipine.purpose: Treats high blood pressure and chest pain (angina)
Amlodipine.precautions: Do not stop suddenly. Avoid grapefruit. Rise slowly from sitting to avoid dizziness.

Omeprazole.purpose: Reduces stomach acid; treats acid reflux, ulcers, and GERD
Omeprazole.precautions: Take 30 minutes before meals. Long-term use may affect bone density and B12 absorption.

Paracetamol.purpose: Relieves mild to moderate pain and reduces fever
Paracetamol.precautions: Never exceed 4g per day (4000mg). Avoid alcohol. Dangerous in overdose - seek help immediately if overdose suspected.

Insulin.purpose: Controls blood sugar in type 1 and type 2 diabetes when oral medications are insufficient
Insulin.precautions: Always carry sugar in case of low blood sugar. Store insulin in refrigerator. Never skip meals after injection.

Amoxicillin.purpose: Treats bacterial infections of ear, throat, lungs, skin, and urinary tract
Amoxicillin.precautions: Complete the full course even if feeling better. Inform doctor about penicillin allergy.

Azithromycin.purpose: Treats bacterial infections including pneumonia, skin, and sexually transmitted infections
Azithromycin.precautions: Complete the full course. May interact with antacids - take 1 hour before or 2 hours after.
